questions.question_text: What wholesale cost is cited for argan oil?
questions.passage: In Casablanca's Habous district, Fatima runs a specialty shop selling extra-virgin argan oil sourced from women's cooperatives near Agadir and Taroudant. Wholesale cost averages 250 MAD/L, and she targets a 22% margin. A Ramadan bundle (2×500 ml) gets a 10% promo discount; social posts and the weekend souk lifted monthly footfall by 18%, raising revenue despite discounts.
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "verbal_reading", "translations": {"fr": {"passage_text": "Dans le quartier des Habous \u00e0 Casablanca, Fatima tient une boutique sp\u00e9cialis\u00e9e vendant de l'huile d'argan extra-vierge provenant de coop\u00e9ratives f\u00e9minines pr\u00e8s d'Agadir et de Taroudant. Le co\u00fbt de gros moyen est de 250 MAD/L, et elle vise une marge de 22 %. Un pack Ramadan (2\u00d7500 ml) b\u00e9n\u00e9ficie d'une remise de 10 % ; les publications et le souk du week-end ont augment\u00e9 la fr\u00e9quentation mensuelle de 18 %, faisant cro\u00eetre le chiffre d'affaires malgr\u00e9 les remises.", "question_text": "Quel co\u00fbt de gros est mentionn\u00e9 pour l'huile d'argan ?", "options": ["200 MAD/L", "250 MAD/L", "280 MAD/L", "300 MAD/L"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "MAD", "metric"]}

fr.passage_text: Dans le quartier des Habous à Casablanca, Fatima tient une boutique spécialisée vendant de l'huile d'argan extra-vierge provenant de coopératives féminines près d'Agadir et de Taroudant. Le coût de gros moyen est de 250 MAD/L, et elle vise une marge de 22 %. Un pack Ramadan (2×500 ml) bénéficie d'une remise de 10 % ; les publications et le souk du week-end ont augmenté la fréquentation mensuelle de 18 %, faisant croître le chiffre d'affaires malgré les remises.
fr.question_text: Quel coût de gros est mentionné pour l'huile d'argan ?

questions.question_text: How far is the farm?
questions.passage: Omar operates a Rabat cold-chain service delivering produce from a farm 120 km away. By redesigning routes and keeping trucks below 80 km/h, fuel use fell 12% while deliveries stayed under 2 hours. Farmers earn 8 MAD/kg for tomatoes; logistics are billed 2 MAD/kg. Supermarkets renewed annual contracts after consistent on-time rates during peak tourism months.
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "verbal_reading", "translations": {"fr": {"passage_text": "Omar exploite un service de cha\u00eene du froid \u00e0 Rabat livrant des produits depuis une ferme \u00e0 120 km. En repensant les itin\u00e9raires et en limitant les camions \u00e0 80 km/h, la consommation a baiss\u00e9 de 12 % tout en gardant les livraisons sous 2 heures. Les agriculteurs gagnent 8 MAD/kg pour les tomates ; la logistique est factur\u00e9e 2 MAD/kg. Les supermarch\u00e9s ont renouvel\u00e9 les contrats annuels gr\u00e2ce \u00e0 la ponctualit\u00e9 lors des pics touristiques.", "question_text": "\u00c0 quelle distance est la ferme ?", "options": ["60 km", "90 km", "120 km", "200 km"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "MAD", "metric"]}

fr.passage_text: Omar exploite un service de chaîne du froid à Rabat livrant des produits depuis une ferme à 120 km. En repensant les itinéraires et en limitant les camions à 80 km/h, la consommation a baissé de 12 % tout en gardant les livraisons sous 2 heures. Les agriculteurs gagnent 8 MAD/kg pour les tomates ; la logistique est facturée 2 MAD/kg. Les supermarchés ont renouvelé les contrats annuels grâce à la ponctualité lors des pics touristiques.
fr.question_text: À quelle distance est la ferme ?

questions.question_text: What is the pack size?
questions.passage: Imane leads a women's cooperative near Essaouira producing artisanal couscous. To reach export grade, they standardized 1 kg packs and added QR codes showing origin and harvest dates. A Marrakech distributor pays 18 MAD/kg with a seasonal bonus above 5,000 kg. Training improved throughput and reduced defects by 15% quarter-over-quarter.
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "verbal_reading", "translations": {"fr": {"passage_text": "Imane dirige une coop\u00e9rative f\u00e9minine pr\u00e8s d'Essaouira produisant du couscous artisanal. Pour l'export, elles ont standardis\u00e9 des sachets de 1 kg et ajout\u00e9 des QR codes indiquant l'origine et les dates de r\u00e9colte. Un distributeur \u00e0 Marrakech paie 18 MAD/kg avec une prime au-del\u00e0 de 5 000 kg. La formation a augment\u00e9 le d\u00e9bit et r\u00e9duit les d\u00e9fauts de 15 % d'un trimestre \u00e0 l'autre.", "question_text": "Quelle est la taille du sachet ?", "options": ["500 g", "1 kg", "2 kg", "5 kg"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "MAD", "metric"]}

fr.passage_text: Imane dirige une coopérative féminine près d'Essaouira produisant du couscous artisanal. Pour l'export, elles ont standardisé des sachets de 1 kg et ajouté des QR codes indiquant l'origine et les dates de récolte. Un distributeur à Marrakech paie 18 MAD/kg avec une prime au-delà de 5 000 kg. La formation a augmenté le débit et réduit les défauts de 15 % d'un trimestre à l'autre.
fr.question_text: Quelle est la taille du sachet ?

questions.question_text: New water flow?
questions.passage: Hassan manages a Chefchaouen guesthouse. Low-flow showers cut water from 12 L/min to 8 L/min. Solar panels now supply 40% of monthly electricity; occupancy improved after partnering with a tour operator, and the property won a local sustainability award.
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "verbal_reading", "translations": {"fr": {"passage_text": "Hassan g\u00e8re une maison d'h\u00f4tes \u00e0 Chefchaouen. Des douches \u00e0 faible d\u00e9bit ont r\u00e9duit l'eau de 12 L/min \u00e0 8 L/min. Des panneaux solaires fournissent 40 % de l'\u00e9lectricit\u00e9 mensuelle ; l'occupation s'est am\u00e9lior\u00e9e apr\u00e8s un partenariat avec un tour-op\u00e9rateur, et l'\u00e9tablissement a re\u00e7u un prix local.", "question_text": "Nouveau d\u00e9bit d'eau ?", "options": ["6 L/min", "8 L/min", "10 L/min", "12 L/min"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "MAD", "metric"]}

questions.question_text: In a complex project with conflicting stakeholder requirements, what is the most effective approach?
options: Choose the requirement from the highest-ranking stakeholder
Implement all requirements regardless of conflicts
Facilitate a stakeholder meeting to prioritize and resolve conflicts
Delay the project until conflicts are resolved externally
questions.explanation: Facilitating stakeholder alignment ensures all voices are heard and creates buy-in for the final decisions.

questions.question_text: Argument: A new tram line reduced traffic in Rabat. Therefore, building tram lines in other cities will reduce traffic. Which option most weakens the argument?
options: Other cities lack the budget to maintain tram systems
Rabat also increased parking fees and bus frequency simultaneously
People prefer to walk in small cities
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "critical_reasoning", "translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Argument : Une nouvelle ligne de tram a r\u00e9duit le trafic \u00e0 Rabat. Donc, construire des lignes de tram dans d'autres villes r\u00e9duira le trafic. Quelle option affaiblit le plus l'argument ?", "options": ["D'autres villes n'ont pas le budget pour entretenir les trams", "Rabat a \u00e9galement augment\u00e9 les tarifs de stationnement et la fr\u00e9quence des bus simultan\u00e9ment", "Les gens pr\u00e9f\u00e8rent marcher dans les petites villes", "Les trams sont confortables et \u00e9cologiques"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "logic", "critical"]}

fr.question_text: Argument : Une nouvelle ligne de tram a réduit le trafic à Rabat. Donc, construire des lignes de tram dans d'autres villes réduira le trafic. Quelle option affaiblit le plus l'argument ?
options: D'autres villes n'ont pas le budget pour entretenir les trams
Rabat a également augmenté les tarifs de stationnement et la fréquence des bus simultanément
Les gens préfèrent marcher dans les petites villes
Les trams sont confortables et écologiques

questions.question_text: Conclusion: Argan oil sales rose after a festival campaign. Therefore, the campaign caused the rise. What is a required assumption?
options: No other major factor affected sales during that period
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "critical_reasoning", "translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Conclusion : Les ventes d'huile d'argan ont augment\u00e9 apr\u00e8s une campagne de festival. Donc, la campagne a caus\u00e9 la hausse. Quelle hypoth\u00e8se est requise ?", "options": ["Aucun autre facteur majeur n'a affect\u00e9 les ventes pendant cette p\u00e9riode", "La campagne \u00e9tait co\u00fbteuse", "Tous les clients ont vu la campagne", "Le produit \u00e9tait en promotion"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "logic", "critical"]}

fr.question_text: Conclusion : Les ventes d'huile d'argan ont augmenté après une campagne de festival. Donc, la campagne a causé la hausse. Quelle hypothèse est requise ?
options: Aucun autre facteur majeur n'a affecté les ventes pendant cette période
Tous les clients ont vu la campagne

questions.question_text: Observation: Shops using the new POS system report fewer errors. Which option most strengthens that the system is the cause?
options: Shops that did not adopt POS show no change in errors
The new system has a modern UI
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "critical_reasoning", "translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Observation : Les boutiques utilisant le nouveau syst\u00e8me POS signalent moins d'erreurs. Quelle option renforce le plus que le syst\u00e8me en est la cause ?", "options": ["Les boutiques qui n'ont pas adopt\u00e9 le POS ne montrent aucun changement d'erreurs", "Le personnel a \u00e9galement \u00e9t\u00e9 form\u00e9", "Le nouveau syst\u00e8me a une interface moderne", "Le mat\u00e9riel POS a \u00e9t\u00e9 offert"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "logic", "critical"]}

fr.question_text: Observation : Les boutiques utilisant le nouveau système POS signalent moins d'erreurs. Quelle option renforce le plus que le système en est la cause ?
options: Les boutiques qui n'ont pas adopté le POS ne montrent aucun changement d'erreurs
Le personnel a également été formé
Le nouveau système a une interface moderne
Le matériel POS a été offert

questions.question_text: Argument: A policy on water conservation in Casablanca improved outcomes. So, the policy causes improvement. Which option most strengthens the argument?
options: A control group without the policy saw no improvement
The policy was announced on TV
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "critical_reasoning", "translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Argument : Une politique sur water conservation \u00e0 Casablanca a am\u00e9lior\u00e9 les r\u00e9sultats. Donc, la politique cause l'am\u00e9lioration. Quelle option renforce le plus l'argument ?", "options": ["Un groupe t\u00e9moin sans la politique n'a vu aucune am\u00e9lioration", "La politique \u00e9tait populaire", "La politique a \u00e9t\u00e9 annonc\u00e9e \u00e0 la TV", "Le budget a augment\u00e9"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "logic", "critical"]}

fr.question_text: Argument : Une politique sur water conservation à Casablanca a amélioré les résultats. Donc, la politique cause l'amélioration. Quelle option renforce le plus l'argument ?
options: Un groupe témoin sans la politique n'a vu aucune amélioration
La politique a été annoncée à la TV

questions.question_text: Claim: A new app reduced littering. Which option most weakens the claim?
options: A seasonal factor already reduces it every year
questions.context: {"locale": "MA", "domain": "critical_reasoning", "translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Affirmation : Une nouvelle application a r\u00e9duit littering. Quelle option affaiblit le plus l'affirmation ?", "options": ["Un facteur saisonnier le r\u00e9duit d\u00e9j\u00e0 chaque ann\u00e9e", "Les utilisateurs ont aim\u00e9 l'interface de l'app", "L'app a eu 10 000 t\u00e9l\u00e9chargements", "Un nouveau logo a \u00e9t\u00e9 lanc\u00e9"]}}, "tags": ["Morocco", "logic", "critical"]}

fr.question_text: Affirmation : Une nouvelle application a réduit littering. Quelle option affaiblit le plus l'affirmation ?
options: Un facteur saisonnier le réduit déjà chaque année
Les utilisateurs ont aimé l'interface de l'app
Un nouveau logo a été lancé

questions.explanation: Time=1h+1h=2h; distance=150; v=150/2=75 km/h.
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Un train de K\u00e9nitra \u00e0 Rabat fait 60 km \u00e0 60 km/h puis 90 km \u00e0 90 km/h. Vitesse moyenne ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "70 km/h"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "72 km/h"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "75 km/h"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "78 km/h"}], "explanation": "Temps=2h; distance=150; v=75 km/h."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

fr.question_text: Un train de Kénitra à Rabat fait 60 km à 60 km/h puis 90 km à 90 km/h. Vitesse moyenne ?

questions.question_text: Compound interest: 12,000 MAD at 5% compounded annually for 4 years. Balance (nearest MAD)?
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Int\u00e9r\u00eat compos\u00e9 : 12 000 MAD \u00e0 5% capitalis\u00e9 annuellement pendant 4 ans. Solde (\u00e0 l\u2019unit\u00e9 pr\u00e8s) ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "14 610 MAD"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "14 500 MAD"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "14 400 MAD"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "14 700 MAD"}], "explanation": "12000\u00d71,05^4 \u2248 14 610."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

fr.question_text: Intérêt composé : 12 000 MAD à 5% capitalisé annuellement pendant 4 ans. Solde (à l’unité près) ?

questions.question_text: A cooperative in Taroudant mixes olive harvests: to make 40 kg at 16% oil from grade A (18%) and B (12%), how many kg of A?
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Une coop\u00e9rative \u00e0 Taroudant m\u00e9lange des olives : pour obtenir 40 kg \u00e0 16% \u00e0 partir de A (18%) et B (12%), masse de A ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "24 kg"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "26,7 kg"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "28 kg"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "30 kg"}], "explanation": "0,18x+0,12(40\u2212x)=6,4 \u21d2 x\u224826,7 kg."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

questions.question_text: A craftsman in Marrakech must tile a 5 m × 3 m room with 25 cm × 25 cm tiles, with 8% extra for waste. How many tiles?
questions.explanation: Area=15 m²; tile=0.0625 m²; exact=240; +8% ≈ 260.
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Un artisan \u00e0 Marrakech doit carreler une pi\u00e8ce de 5 m \u00d7 3 m avec des carreaux 25 \u00d7 25 cm, avec 8% de marge. Combien de carreaux ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "240"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "250"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "260"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "280"}], "explanation": "Surface=15 m\u00b2; carreau=0,0625 m\u00b2; +8% \u2248 260."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

fr.question_text: Un artisan à Marrakech doit carreler une pièce de 5 m × 3 m avec des carreaux 25 × 25 cm, avec 8% de marge. Combien de carreaux ?

questions.question_text: A fruit seller buys 400 oranges at 1.5 MAD each; 10% spoil. To get 25% profit overall, selling price per remaining orange?
questions.explanation: Cost=600 MAD; good=360; revenue target=750; price=750/360≈2.08 ⇒ ≈2.1 MAD.
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Un vendeur ach\u00e8te 400 oranges \u00e0 1,5 MAD; 10% se g\u00e2tent. Pour 25% de profit global, prix/unit\u00e9 des restantes ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "2,0 MAD"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "2,1 MAD"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "2,2 MAD"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "2,3 MAD"}], "explanation": "Co\u00fbt=600 MAD; bonnes=360; prix\u22482,1 MAD."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

questions.question_text: In a Casablanca workshop, two taps fill a tank: A in 40 min, B in 60 min, with a leak emptying 1/120 of tank per min. Fill time?

Temps de remplissage ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "28 min"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "30 min"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "32 min"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "36 min"}], "explanation": "D\u00e9bit=1/30 \u21d2 30 min."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

questions.question_text: An item costs 1,500 MAD before tax. After adding 20% VAT then a 10% discount on the tax-included price, final price?

Apr\u00e8s TVA 20% puis remise 10% sur le TTC, prix final ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "1 560 MAD"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "1 620 MAD"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "1 680 MAD"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "1 700 MAD"}], "explanation": "HT=1500 \u2192 TTC=1800 \u2192 \u221210% \u21d2 1 620 MAD."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

questions.question_text: An argan cooperative has fixed costs 10,000 MAD and variable 12 MAD/unit; selling price 25 MAD. Break-even units?
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Une coop\u00e9rative d\u2019argan a des co\u00fbts fixes de 10 000 MAD et variables de 12 MAD/unit\u00e9; prix 25 MAD. Seuil de rentabilit\u00e9 ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "750"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "760"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "770"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "800"}], "explanation": "Seuil=10000/(25\u221212)\u2248770."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

questions.question_text: A train from Rabat to Fes covers 300 km at an average of 75 km/h including a 20‑minute stop. What is the running speed (excluding stop)?
questions.context: {"translations": {"fr": {"question_text": "Un train de Rabat \u00e0 F\u00e8s parcourt 300 km \u00e0 une moyenne de 75 km/h avec un arr\u00eat de 20 min inclus. Vitesse en marche (hors arr\u00eat) ?", "options": [{"option_id": "A", "text": "80 km/h"}, {"option_id": "B", "text": "82 km/h"}, {"option_id": "C", "text": "84 km/h"}, {"option_id": "D", "text": "86 km/h"}], "explanation": "Temps total=4 h; temps de marche\u22483,667 h; v\u224882 km/h."}}, "metadata": {"category": "arithmetic", "requires_calculator": false, "multiple_steps": false, "moroccan_context": true}}

fr.question_text: Un train de Rabat à Fès parcourt 300 km à une moyenne de 75 km/h avec un arrêt de 20 min inclus. Vitesse en marche (hors arrêt) ?
fr.explanation: Temps total=4 h; temps de marche≈3,667 h; v≈82 km/h.

questions.question_text: In a survey of 200 people, 60% said they prefer coffee. How many people prefer coffee?
A company's revenue increased from $50,000 to $65,000. What is the percentage increase?
If the average of 5 numbers is 20, what is their sum?
questions.explanation: Average = Sum ÷ Count, so Sum = Average × Count = 20 × 5 = 100

questions.question_text: A store offers a 20% discount on all items. If an item costs $80, what is the sale price?
questions.explanation: Discount = 20% of $80 = $16. Sale price = $80 - $16 = $64

questions.question_text: In a class of 30 students, 18 are girls. What percentage are boys?
A rectangle has a length of 8 cm and width of 6 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area = Length × Width = 8 cm × 6 cm = 48 cm²

questions.question_text: John is 3 times as old as his son. If the son is 8 years old, how old is John?
questions.explanation: John's age = 3 × Son's age = 3 × 8 = 24 years

questions.question_text: A car travels 180 km in 3 hours. How far will it travel in 5 hours at the same speed?
questions.explanation: Speed = 180 km ÷ 3 hours = 60 km/h. Distance in 5 hours = 60 × 5 = 300 km

questions.question_text: If 3 workers can complete a job in 8 days, how many days will it take 6 workers?
questions.explanation: More workers = less time. 6 workers is 2 times 3 workers, so time is halved: 8 ÷ 2 = 4 days

questions.question_text: A number is increased by 25% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net change?
questions.explanation: Let original = 100. After 25% increase: 125. After 20% decrease: 125 × 0.8 = 100. Net change = 0%

questions.question_text: How many direct connections does Node A have?
questions.explanation: Node A has direct connections to B and C, so 2 connections.
questions.context: Network: A connects to B and C, B connects to D, C connects to E

questions.question_text: What is the shortest path from A to D?
questions.explanation: A-E-D has 2 hops, while A-B-C-D and A-F-G-D have 3 hops each.
questions.context: Network: A-B-C-D, A-E-D, A-F-G-D

questions.question_text: Which node is a bottleneck in this network?
questions.explanation: Hub H is the bottleneck as all traffic must pass through it.
questions.context: Network: All nodes connect through a central hub H

questions.question_text: If Node X fails, how many nodes become disconnected?
questions.explanation: If X fails, A, B, C, and D become disconnected (4 nodes). E and F remain connected.
questions.context: Network: A-X-B, C-X-D, E-F (X is central node)

questions.question_text: What is the network redundancy level?
questions.explanation: Redundancy level is 2 since each node has 2 alternative paths.
questions.context: Network: Each node has 2 alternative paths to reach any other node

questions.question_text: What should replace the question mark in this matrix?
questions.explanation: The matrix follows alphabetical order: A,B,C in first row, D,E,F in second row, so G,H,I in third row.
questions.context: Matrix: [A B C] [D E F] [G H ?]

questions.question_text: Which pattern completes the matrix?
questions.explanation: The matrix follows numerical order: 1,2,3 in first row, 4,5,6 in second row, so 7,8,9 in third row.

questions.question_text: What is the missing element?
questions.explanation: Each row shifts one position to the right: A,B,C → B,C,D → C,D,E.
questions.context: Matrix: [A B C] [B C D] [C D ?]

questions.question_text: Which symbol completes the pattern?
questions.explanation: Each row rotates the symbols: ○,□,△ → □,△,○ → △,○,□.

questions.question_text: What should be in the bottom right corner?
questions.explanation: Each row is multiplied by its row number: 1×1,2×1,3×1 → 1×2,2×2,3×2 → 1×3,2×3,3×3.

questions.question_text: What comes next in this series?
questions.explanation: The series increases by 2 each time: 2+2=4, 4+2=6, 6+2=8, 8+2=10.

questions.question_text: Which number completes the sequence?
questions.explanation: The sequence represents perfect squares: 1²=1, 2²=4, 3²=9, 4²=16, 5²=25.
questions.context: Sequence: 1, 4, 9, 16, ?

questions.question_text: What is the next term?
questions.explanation: The series skips 2 letters each time: A (skip B,C) D (skip E,F) G (skip H,I) J, so next is M.
questions.context: Series: A, D, G, J, ?

questions.question_text: Which pattern completes the series?
questions.explanation: This is the Fibonacci sequence: each number is the sum of the two preceding numbers: 1+1=2, 1+2=3, 2+3=5, 3+5=8.

questions.question_text: What comes next in this abstract series?
questions.explanation: Each number is double the previous: 3×2=6, 6×2=12, 12×2=24, 24×2=48.

questions.question_text: What is the most appropriate response to ensure inclusion?
options: Speak privately with the team lead and propose inclusive meeting practices
Wait until the project stabilizes, then bring it up
Make a light joke to ease tension and continue
Ignore it; Amina will adapt over time

scenario.en:
You join a new team in Casablanca. During meetings, Amina's ideas are overlooked and she is rarely invited to key chats.

Team context: The development team consists of 8 members with varying experience levels. Recent sprint retrospectives revealed communication gaps affecting productivity. The team lead Omar has been with the company for 3 years and values inclusive decision-making. Current project deadlines are tight with a client demo scheduled in 5 days. Team morale surveys indicate some members feel their contributions aren't recognized. The company culture emphasizes collaboration and psychological safety.
scenario.fr:
Vous rejoignez une nouvelle équipe à Casablanca. Pendant les réunions, les idées d'Amina sont négligées et elle est rarement invitée aux discussions clés.

Contexte d'équipe : L'équipe de développement se compose de 8 membres avec des niveaux d'expérience variés. Les rétrospectives de sprint récentes ont révélé des lacunes de communication affectant la productivité. Le chef d'équipe Omar est dans l'entreprise depuis 3 ans et valorise la prise de décision inclusive. Les délais actuels du projet sont serrés avec une démo client prévue dans 5 jours. Les enquêtes de moral d'équipe indiquent que certains membres estiment que leurs contributions ne sont pas reconnues. La culture d'entreprise met l'accent sur la collaboration et la sécurité psychologique.

fr.question_text: Quelle est la meilleure réponse pour garantir l'inclusion ?
options: Parler en privé avec le chef d'équipe et proposer des pratiques inclusives
Attendre que le projet se stabilise puis en parler
Faire une blague pour détendre l'atmosphère et continuer
Ignorer; Amina s'adaptera avec le temps

questions.question_text: How should you respond first?
options: Address their concerns immediately with a concrete recovery plan
Escalate to your manager while keeping the client informed
Wait to see if the client calms down
Let them cancel to avoid further issues

scenario.en:
A client in Rabat threatens to cancel due to recent service issues. They represent significant revenue.

Client context: This client represents 25% of annual revenue (1.8M MAD) and has been with the company for 2 years. They operate in the financial services sector with strict regulatory requirements. Previous escalations were resolved through transparent communication and proactive solutions. The client's technical team in Rabat expects weekly progress reports and immediate notification of any issues. Contract renewal discussions are scheduled for next quarter. The relationship manager Fatima has built strong trust with their stakeholders.
scenario.fr:
Un client à Rabat menace de résilier à cause de problèmes de service récents. Il représente un revenu important.

Contexte client : Ce client représente 25% du chiffre d'affaires annuel (1,8M MAD) et est avec l'entreprise depuis 2 ans. Il opère dans le secteur des services financiers avec des exigences réglementaires strictes. Les escalades précédentes ont été résolues grâce à une communication transparente et des solutions proactives. L'équipe technique du client à Rabat attend des rapports de progrès hebdomadaires et une notification immédiate de tout problème. Les discussions de renouvellement de contrat sont prévues pour le prochain trimestre. La responsable de relation Fatima a établi une forte confiance avec leurs parties prenantes.

fr.question_text: Quelle devrait être votre première action ?
options: Traiter leurs préoccupations immédiatement avec un plan concret
Escalader à votre manager tout en tenant le client informé
Attendre pour voir si le client se calme
Les laisser résilier pour éviter d'autres problèmes

questions.question_text: What should you do?
options: Investigate and report findings to finance and management
Document and wait to see if it stops
Ignore it since amounts are small

scenario.en:
You discover systematic overbilling of small amounts from a vendor in Marrakech.

Vendor context: The company works with 15+ vendors across different services with contracts totaling 3.2M MAD annually. Procurement policies require competitive bidding for contracts over 50,000 MAD. The finance team led by Hassan conducts monthly vendor performance reviews. Recent supply chain disruptions have emphasized the importance of vendor reliability. All vendor relationships are governed by strict SLAs with penalty clauses. The procurement manager Imane maintains detailed vendor scorecards and relationship histories.
scenario.fr:
Vous découvrez une surfacturation systématique de petits montants d'un fournisseur à Marrakech.

Contexte fournisseur : L'entreprise travaille avec plus de 15 fournisseurs sur différents services avec des contrats totalisant 3,2M MAD annuellement. Les politiques d'approvisionnement exigent des appels d'offres concurrentiels pour les contrats de plus de 50 000 MAD. L'équipe financière dirigée par Hassan effectue des évaluations mensuelles de performance des fournisseurs. Les perturbations récentes de la chaîne d'approvisionnement ont souligné l'importance de la fiabilité des fournisseurs. Toutes les relations fournisseurs sont régies par des SLA stricts avec des clauses de pénalité. La responsable des achats Imane maintient des tableaux de bord détaillés des fournisseurs et des historiques de relations.

fr.question_text: Que devriez-vous faire ?
options: Enquêter et signaler les résultats à la finance et à la direction
En discuter d'abord avec votre supérieur
Documenter et attendre pour voir si cela cesse
Ignorer puisque les montants sont faibles

questions.question_text: What is the most appropriate response?
options: Address the issue immediately while proposing a practical solution
Wait to see if it resolves itself

scenario.en:
In Casablanca, Resistance to a new software rollout. Ahmed mentions pressure to meet a deadline.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All birds have feathers.
Premise 2: Penguins are birds.
Conclusion: Penguins have feathers.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid syllogism. If all birds have feathers and penguins are birds, then penguins must have feathers.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If it rains, the ground gets wet.
Premise 2: It is raining.
Conclusion: The ground is wet.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid modus ponens. If P then Q, and P is true, therefore Q is true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All students must wear uniforms.
Premise 2: John is a student.
Conclusion: John must wear a uniform.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid syllogism. If all students must wear uniforms and John is a student, then John must wear a uniform.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If the car is out of gas, it will not start.
Premise 2: The car will not start.
Conclusion: The car is out of gas.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of affirming the consequent. The car may not start for reasons other than being out of gas.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All roses are flowers.
Premise 2: This is a rose.
Conclusion: This is a flower.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid syllogism. If all roses are flowers and this is a rose, then this is a flower.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
Premise 2: You did not study hard.
Conclusion: You will not pass the exam.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of denying the antecedent. Not studying hard does not necessarily mean you will fail; you might pass for other reasons.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All mammals are warm-blooded.
Premise 2: Whales are mammals.
Conclusion: Whales are warm-blooded.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid syllogism. If all mammals are warm-blooded and whales are mammals, then whales are warm-blooded.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If the door is locked, we cannot enter.
Premise 2: We cannot enter.
Conclusion: The door is locked.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of affirming the consequent. There may be other reasons why we cannot enter besides the door being locked.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All triangles have three sides.
Premise 2: This shape has three sides.
Conclusion: This shape is a triangle.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of affirming the consequent. Having three sides is necessary but not sufficient to be a triangle.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If it is snowing, the temperature is below freezing.
Premise 2: The temperature is below freezing.
Conclusion: It is snowing.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of affirming the consequent. Below-freezing temperature is necessary but not sufficient for snow.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If A implies B, and B implies C, then A implies C.
Premise 2: If it rains, the ground gets wet.
Premise 3: If the ground gets wet, plants grow better.
Conclusion: If it rains, plants grow better.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid chain of implications. If A→B and B→C, then A→C. Rain→wet ground→better plant growth, so rain→better plant growth.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: Either P or Q is true.
Premise 2: P is false.
Conclusion: Q is true.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid disjunctive syllogism. If P∨Q and ¬P, then Q must be true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All A are B.
Premise 2: Some B are C.
Conclusion: Some A are C.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is the fallacy of undistributed middle. The conclusion does not follow because the middle term B is not distributed in the second premise.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If not A, then B.
Premise 2: If B, then C.
Premise 3: Not C.
Conclusion: A.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If ¬A→B and B→C, then ¬A→C. If ¬C, then by contraposition, ¬(¬A), which means A.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All X are Y.
Premise 2: No Y are Z.
Conclusion: No X are Z.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is a valid syllogism. If all X are Y and no Y are Z, then no X are Z (by transitivity of the universal negative).

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If A and B, then C.
Premise 2: A is true.
Premise 3: B is true.
Conclusion: C is true.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If (A∧B)→C and both A and B are true, then A∧B is true, so C must be true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: Some A are B.
Premise 2: All B are C.
Conclusion: Some A are C.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If some A are B and all B are C, then some A are C (by transitivity of the particular affirmative).

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If P, then Q.
Premise 2: If Q, then R.
Premise 3: If R, then S.
Premise 4: P is true.
Conclusion: S is true.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If P→Q, Q→R, R→S, and P is true, then by modus ponens: Q is true, then R is true, then S is true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: Either A or B or C.
Premise 2: Not A.
Premise 3: Not B.
Conclusion: C.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If A∨B∨C and both ¬A and ¬B, then by elimination, C must be true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All X are Y.
Premise 2: Some Y are Z.
Premise 3: All Z are W.
Conclusion: Some X are W.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is invalid. The middle term Y is not distributed in the second premise, making this an invalid syllogism.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If (A and B) or (C and D), then E.
Premise 2: If E, then F.
Premise 3: Not F.
Premise 4: A is true.
Premise 5: B is true.
Conclusion: Not (C and D).

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If (A∧B)∨(C∧D)→E and E→F, then (A∧B)∨(C∧D)→F. If ¬F, then ¬[(A∧B)∨(C∧D)]. Since A∧B is true, ¬(C∧D) must be true.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: For all x, if P(x) then Q(x).
Premise 2: For all x, if Q(x) then R(x).
Premise 3: There exists an x such that P(x).
Conclusion: There exists an x such that R(x).

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If ∀x(P(x)→Q(x)) and ∀x(Q(x)→R(x)), then ∀x(P(x)→R(x)). If ∃xP(x), then by modus ponens, ∃xR(x).

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If A implies B, then C implies D.
Premise 2: If C implies D, then E implies F.
Premise 3: A implies B.
Premise 4: Not F.
Conclusion: Not E.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If (A→B)→(C→D) and (C→D)→(E→F), then (A→B)→(E→F). If A→B and ¬F, then by modus tollens, ¬E.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All A are B.
Premise 2: Some B are not C.
Premise 3: All C are D.
Conclusion: Some A are not D.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is invalid. The conclusion does not follow because the premises do not establish a connection between A and D through the given relationships.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If P then (Q or R).
Premise 2: If Q then S.
Premise 3: If R then T.
Premise 4: P is true.
Premise 5: Not S.
Premise 6: Not T.
Conclusion: Contradiction.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If P→(Q∨R), Q→S, R→T, P is true, and both ¬S and ¬T, then we have Q∨R, but both Q and R lead to contradictions, so the premises are inconsistent.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: For all x, (P(x) and Q(x)) implies R(x).
Premise 2: There exists an x such that P(x) and not R(x).
Conclusion: There exists an x such that not Q(x).

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If ∀x((P(x)∧Q(x))→R(x)) and ∃x(P(x)∧¬R(x)), then for some x, P(x) is true but R(x) is false. Since (P(x)∧Q(x))→R(x), we must have ¬(P(x)∧Q(x)), which means ¬Q(x).

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If A then (B and C).
Premise 2: If (B and C) then D.
Premise 3: If D then E.
Premise 4: A is true.
Premise 5: Not E.
Conclusion: The premises are inconsistent.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If A→(B∧C), (B∧C)→D, D→E, A is true, and ¬E, then we have A→E but ¬E, which is a contradiction, making the premises inconsistent.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: All X are Y.
Premise 2: Some Y are Z.
Premise 3: All Z are W.
Premise 4: No W are V.
Conclusion: Some X are not V.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is invalid. The premises do not establish a sufficient connection between X and V to validly conclude that some X are not V.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: If P then Q.
Premise 2: If R then S.
Premise 3: P or R.
Premise 4: Not Q.
Premise 5: Not S.
Conclusion: Contradiction.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If P→Q, R→S, P∨R, ¬Q, and ¬S, then by modus tollens, ¬P and ¬R. But P∨R requires at least one to be true, creating a contradiction.

questions.question_text:
Premise 1: For all x, if P(x) then Q(x).
Premise 2: For all x, if Q(x) then R(x).
Premise 3: For all x, if R(x) then S(x).
Premise 4: There exists an x such that P(x).
Premise 5: There exists an x such that not S(x).
Conclusion: The premises are inconsistent.

Is this conclusion valid?
questions.explanation: This is valid. If ∀x(P(x)→Q(x)), ∀x(Q(x)→R(x)), ∀x(R(x)→S(x)), ∃xP(x), and ∃x¬S(x), then we have P(x)→S(x) for all x, but some x has ¬S(x), creating a contradiction.
